column1: Greenland may be a name for Valinor used by J.R.R. Tolkien.  It appears only once
column2: in a quick note written c. late 1939
column3: while Tolkien was still brainstorming for his plot in the Fourth Phase.  It states clearly
column4: speaking of Frodo Baggins and Samwise Gamgee in the end of the story
column5: "They go west and set sail to Greenland".  In a more complete set of notes dating to the same approximate time
column7: there is similarly written "a green land by the Sea".
